fields.description:
- When building an app all possible platforms are configured before each build, including ones that are not targeted
- We should only configure the platforms that are being targeted for that build
fields.summary: Only configure platforms that are deployment targets

comments.body: This got pulled into 6.1.1 through https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/9177, marking as such

Verified using

Ti SDK: 6.1.1.v20170626160851
Appc CLI: 6.2.2
Appc NPM: 4.2.9
Appc Studio: 4.9.0.201705302345

I caused failures in the build process in the following ways

h5. Windows as an authoring OS

h6. Android builds
# Moved the winappdeploycmd executable to a different location
# Ran a build for Android

h6. Windows builds


# Added a bad require to the android _build.js file
# Ran a build for Windows

h5. OSX as an authoring OS

h6. Android builds
# Added a bad require to the ios _build.js file
# Ran a build for Android from Studio and CLI

h6.OS builds
# Added a bad require to the android _build.js file
# Ran a build for iOS (using the iphone, ipad and ios {{--platform}} aliases)

In all cases, on 6.0.4.GA the build would error out due to the other platform failing. On 6.1.1.v20170626160851 the build would not fail when the other platform fails
